intro: Viola chassanica, commonly known as the violet of the Alps, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viola chassanica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a wildflower in alpine habitats.
